N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 30.1 - Payment for accruals upon separation

State Regulations

At the time of separation from State service, an employee, such employee's estate or beneficiary, as the case may be, shall be compensated
in cash for overtime credits not in excess of 30 days accrued and unused as of
the effective date of separation; and further, except where provision is made
for the transfer of leave credits, the employee shall be compensated in cash
for vacation credits not in excess of 30 days accrued and unused as of the
effective date of separation, except that in the case of resignation, the
appointing authority may require, as a condition for such payment, that written
notice of such resignation be given to the appointing authority at least two
weeks prior to the last day of work. No employee who is removed from State
service as a result of disciplinary action, or who resigns after charges of
incompetency or misconduct have been served, shall be entitled to compensation
for vacation credits under the provisions of this Part. Notes
